stories.text:
When a flow is directly triggered by a users action, we have the Cookie/Token of the user to do AuthN/AuthZ.

However when we need to run background jobs or some asynchronous workflow on behalf of the user, we do not have the Cookie/Token of the user. We do have the user id but not the session. How do you solve for AuthZ specifically for your background jobs and dependent microservices?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you do authorization for background jobs?

stories.text:
What are some good software projects on GitHub where I can see how they became small => big or simple => complex over time - commit by commit?

I am more interested in seeing how complex software is built from scratch, using best practices, than any specific programming language.
